main event: Several unidentified aerial objects were observed over Slagle Lake, LA on 8 August 1952.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be disc-shaped and emitted a glow., They were estimated to be moving at a speed of 1000 mph., The sighting lasted for approximately 3 to 4 seconds., One witness described the objects as approximately 40 to 50 feet in diameter., The visibility during the sighting was reported as clear, with no moonlight.
witness description: Master Sergeant Frank Polk, a driver from Williams Air Force Base.
